thread.title: Lorraine Hack Joins Korn Ferry as Senior Client Partner

author: cnbc.com
title: Lorraine Hack Joins Korn Ferry as Senior Client Partner
text:
LOS ANGELES--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Korn Ferry (NYSE:KFY) today announced that Lorraine Hack has joined the firm as a senior client partner in their Technology practice. She is based in the New York office.
Hack joins Korn Ferry from a global executive search firm, where she was a member of its Technology and Consumer practices. She led searches in general management, financial officers and marketing for clients in multiple industries, ranging from early stage, private equity-backed through large corporations, both public and private.
Previously, she served as a COO and as a strategy and finance executive in the media/entertainment space, working at companies including MTV Networks, Blockbuster, Sesame Workshop, HBO and Paramount Pictures.
“Lorraine is an accomplished leader, recognized for deep digital expertise that spans industry sectors,” said Doug Charles, president of the Americas, Korn Ferry. “Her breadth of search and industry experience, along with a specialization in the consumer market, will be of great benefit to our clients and firm. We are thrilled to have her join the team.”
Hack earned a Bachelor of Science in finance and international business from New York University, and an MBA in media and communications from the Fordham University Graduate School of Business Administration. She is a founding board member of W.O.M.E.N. in America, a mentorship program that partners high-potential with high-level female executives in various fields; she was named chair in 2015.
About Korn Ferry
Korn Ferry is a global organizational consulting firm. We help companies design their organization – the structure, the roles and responsibilities, as well as how they compensate, develop and motivate their people. As importantly, we help organizations select and hire the talent they need to execute their strategy. Our approximately 7,000 colleagues serve clients in more than 50 countries.
